reviewsJson.markdown:
**Setup**

RDA/ Recoil Coil/ 6 Wrap Dual Fused Kanthal Clapton 2Ã—28 core 32 wrap W/ 45 Wicking/ 
Full cottonbacon V2 @ /0.44

**Testing**

Steep Time/3 weeks % Used/ 5 PG-VG/ 50/50 Nic%/0 

**Mouthfeel**

Heavy on the tongue and nose with a syrupy mouthfeel. Another Super dense flavor 8 out of 10.

**Throat Hit**

4/10

**Flavor Properties** 

The flavoring can be broken into two parts pineapple and Peach.

*Pineapple - this flavor comes out sweet and juicy with just a touch of citrus. Pineapple is very realistic fresh crisp pineapple not that canned garbage you get on a pizza. It has a juicy slightly syrupy aspect to it adding to the density of the flavoring.

*Peach - slightly candied Peach flavoring similar to Peach gummies rings. But I also get that slightly fuzzy fantastic Peach skin. I'd say the peach in this is halfway between a candy and a very authentic flavoring.


**Position In The Recipe**

Flavoring is super dense and because of that I believe will work best as a base note. 

**Off Flavors**

The fuzzy flavoring about Peach skin comes off very dry and although this flavoring is wet and juicy, it still somehow still dry on the inhale.

**Pairings**

Flavoring should pair well with most Citrus flavorings. A few fruits such as Apple, and dragon fruit. Vanilla and tobaccos should also pair nicely.

**Notes**


Purchased this on a whim, I was interested to see how flavor West, combined these two profiles.  I have to say I am pleasantly surprised. This could easily be a single flavor mix or part of a complex profile. Reminds me a lot of Coke cans nebula recipe.

**Rating**7

80/100

Please if your opinion differs, or you have another review for this post , then leave a fucking comment. ;p
reviewsJson.author: Chrisdvr1
reviewsJson.title: Pineapple Peach
